body:
Concept ACK.

Perhaps the test with valid command can create a file in test or `tmp` dir and checks if this file was created..

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#22776](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22776) (rpc/wallet: add optional transaction(s) to getbalances by kallewoof)
* [#22751](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22751) (rpc/wallet: add simulaterawtransaction RPC by kallewoof)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

I've tried different valid commands with -startupnotify like: `echo` (common command for Unix system and Windows), tried a simple `ls` for Unix and `dir` for Windows and other ones, but the CI is failing for all of them. Any thoughts about it, @MarcoFalke?

You can find the error in the log:

```
 node0 stderr Error: The experimental syscall sandbox feature (-sandbox=<mode>) is incompatible with -startupnotify (which uses execve).

> You can find the error in the log:
> 
> ```
>  node0 stderr Error: The experimental syscall sandbox feature (-sandbox=<mode>) is incompatible with -startupnotify (which uses execve). 
> ```

Sorry, I read that but didn't notice this part of the log. Thanks.
Concept ACK
Force-pushed with a update on `expected_stderr` in `stop_node`. I just edited the description.
Win64 has failed: I think the problem may be the breaklines. Going to work to fix it.
Force-pushed adding `os.linesep` into expected windows message.

In e9ebe3b, shouldn't it be this?

```suggestion
        f"'{INVALID_COMMAND}' is not recognized as an internal or external command,{os.linesep}operable program or batch file."]
```
diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,37 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2020 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Test -startupnotify."""
+
+import platform
+import os
+
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+
+INVALID_COMMAND = "abc"
+
+
+class StartupNotifyTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.num_nodes = 1
+        self.disable_syscall_sandbox = True
+        if platform.system() == "Windows":
+            self.extra_args = [["-startupnotify=dir"]]
+        else:
+            self.extra_args = [["-startupnotify=ls"]]
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        self.log.info("Test the node starts with a valid command on -startupnotify")
+        self.stop_node(0)
+        self.log.info("Test the node starts with an invalid command on -startupnotify")
+        self.start_node(0, extra_args=[f"-startupnotify={INVALID_COMMAND}"])
+
+        stderrs = [f"sh: {INVALID_COMMAND}: command not found", f"sh: 1: {INVALID_COMMAND}: not found",
+        f"AssertionError: Unexpected stderr '{INVALID_COMMAND}' is not recognized as an internal or external command,{os.linesep}operable program or batch file."]

body: Do we need tests for to check the operating systems exact response to an invalid command? This doesn't increase the test coverage of Bitcoin Core itself and it seems a bit painful to maintain.

body: I agree it seems a bit painful to maintain, but if we don't pass an expected error message the test will fail. I think the stop_node could have a boolean flag when expecting error without specifing the message it would be helpful. What do you think?

body:
Not sure if the right is:  
`f"'{INVALID_COMMAND}' is not recognized as an internal or external command,{os.linesep}operable program or batch file."]` or `f"Unexpected stderr '{INVALID_COMMAND}' is not recognized as an internal or external command,{os.linesep}operable program or batch file."`

Going to test it, thanks!

body: It should be the first option because "AssertionError: Unexpected stderr" comes from [L351](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/7f462b1a95a48762186783fadf01ae8f3c6df56f/test/functional/test_framework/test_node.py#L351). There shouldn't be a space before `{os.linesep}` in  [L31](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/7f462b1a95a48762186783fadf01ae8f3c6df56f/test/functional/feature_startupnotify.py#L31)?

body: Force-pushed addressing the reviews, thanks everyone for them. I just changed the approach for this test (updated the description).

```suggestion
        self.log.info("Test -startupnotify command is run when node starts")
```
diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,26 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2020 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Test -startupnotify."""
+
+import os
+
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+
+
+class StartupNotifyTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.num_nodes = 1
+        self.disable_syscall_sandbox = True
+        self.extra_args = [["-startupnotify=echo 'test' >> node0/test.txt"]]
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        tmpdir = os.path.join(self.options.tmpdir, "node0", "test.txt")
+
+        self.log.info("When node starts, check if test.txt exists")

body:
> Ideally, a test for `-startupnotify` should ensure that the command is executed exactly once, and when it is executed, the node is fully started (which may involve races which make it difficult to deterministically fail).

Maybe checking the expected result of an RPC (like getblockcount) could verify the node is fully up.
Thank you for the suggestions, they are very relevant, I am going to implement them.

body: Force-pushed addressing @luke-jr and @jonatack tips. Thanks for the reviews.
ACK, modulo unrelated code that appears to have crept into the last push?

> ACK, modulo unrelated code that appears to have crept into the last push?

omg, didn't understand why it happened, going to check it.
fixed commits! @jonatack

tested ACK 98014c5

OS: Arch Linux 64 bits (Linux 5.12.19-hardened1-1-hardened x86_64)
System: AMD Ryzen 5 64 bits + AMD VEGA 8 with 12GB RAM
Build: Compiled from source with no additional `./configure` options

Tests:
Ran the test alone, it worked!
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40968167/147137206-ad227a81-f5cd-4e3a-91cf-751c138ea4d3.png)
Also, all the tests with `test/functional/test_runner.py`, again everything is working just fine!
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40968167/147148104-f9744d12-8622-470a-b0c4-b7b990016706.png)
Check should be added to not only existence of the file but also exact file contents, that will address @luke-jr comment about testing that `-startupnotify` command is executed only once.
diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2020 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Test -startupnotify."""
+
+import os
+
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+from test_framework.util import (
+    assert_equal,
+)
+
+NODE_DIR = "node0"
+FILE_NAME = "test.txt"
+
+
+class StartupNotifyTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.num_nodes = 1
+        self.disable_syscall_sandbox = True
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        tmpdir = os.path.join(self.options.tmpdir, NODE_DIR, FILE_NAME)
+        assert not os.path.exists(tmpdir)
+
+        self.log.info("Test -startupnotify command is run when node starts")
+        self.restart_node(0, extra_args=[f"-startupnotify=echo '{FILE_NAME}' >> {NODE_DIR}/{FILE_NAME}"])
+        assert os.path.exists(tmpdir)

body: force-pushed addressing @luke-jr and @kristapsk reviews (check if the command is executed once).

```
feature_startupnotify.py                           | â Failed  | 2 s

> ```
> feature_startupnotify.py                           | â Failed  | 2 s
> ```

Fixed!

Concept and approach ACK. Tested and working fine :)
I saw that `startupnotify` uses [execve](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/4747da3a5b639b5a336b737e7e3cbf060cf2efcf#diff-b1e19192258d83199d8adaa5ac31f067af98f63554bfdd679bd8e8073815e69dR1038) and I was wondering if that could be checked on the test, somehow like: in case of using sandbox (if defined(`USE_SYSCALL_SANDBOX`), `startupnotify` will not throw?
